detaileddescription.para: BME280_INTF_RET_TYPE is the read/write interface return type which can be overwritten by the build system.
The last error code from read/write interface is stored in the device structure as intf_rslt.

description.para: These values are internal for API implementation. Don't relate this to data sheet.

sectiondef.header: Macro to combine two 8 bit data's to form a 16 bit data
Macro to SET and GET BITS of a register

memberdef.definition: typedef BME280_INTF_RET_TYPE(* bme280_read_fptr_t) (uint8_t reg_addr, uint8_t *reg_data, uint32_t len, void *intf_ptr)
memberdef.name: bme280_read_fptr_t

briefdescription.para: Bus communication function pointer which should be mapped to the platform specific read functions of the user.

parameterdescription.para: : Register address from which data is read.
: Pointer to data buffer where read data is stored.
: Number of bytes of data to be read.
: Void pointer that can enable the linking of descriptors for interface related call backs.

memberdef.definition: typedef BME280_INTF_RET_TYPE(* bme280_write_fptr_t) (uint8_t reg_addr, const uint8_t *reg_data, uint32_t len, void *intf_ptr)
memberdef.argsstring: )(uint8_t reg_addr, const uint8_t *reg_data, uint32_t len, void *intf_ptr)
memberdef.name: bme280_write_fptr_t

briefdescription.para: Bus communication function pointer which should be mapped to the platform specific write functions of the user.

parameterdescription.para: : Register address to which the data is written.
: Pointer to data buffer in which data to be written is stored.
: Number of bytes of data to be written.
: Void pointer that can enable the linking of descriptors for interface related call backs

briefdescription.para: Delay function pointer which should be mapped to delay function of the user.

parameterdescription.para: : Void pointer that can enable the linking of descriptors for interface related call backs
